title: () Abrantes -
description: Park dedicated to motorhomes next to Historic Center

title: (2200-201) Abrantes - Esplanada 1 de Maio
description: Super large motorhome parking with a bird's eye view of the Tagus, just behind the courtyard, ideal for a quiet night. Free parking without amenities, which is also used by passenger cars. Amusement center next door, lots of shopping and parties every night.

title: (2200-241) Abrantes - 3 Rua do Girassol
description: Free parking near the city center except market day.

title: (2200-365) Abrantes - 26 Rua 17 de Agosto de 1808
description: Very central flat parking with an incredible view towards south. very calm. fantastic night 200m away from the main brand new museum of Abrantes, very worthy to visit. obligatory to eat at the Santa Isabel restaurant and buy the wonderful sweets at the Palha de Abrantes coffee shop.

title: (2200-420) Abrantes - 37 Rua do Pisco
description: Shop where gas bottles can be exchanged. Also the Campinggaz bottles. Not an LPG station. It is also difficult to get there with a camper / car. I went by bicycle. Have been looking for a shop to exchange camping gas bottles for a long time. You can do that here!!

title: (2200-187) Abrantes - 221 Rua Cidade de Parthenay
description: Self Service Laundry

title: (2200) Abrantes - 708 Avenida da Portagem
description:
With a great view to the Ríver Tejo. no facilities. 
This is an authorised location. Overnight stay Up to 48 hrs

title: () Abrantes - Esplanada das Docas
description: Parking at the Rio Tejo directly at a busy restaurant and pub, which is open on weekends until 3 am.  There are several waste containers nearby.  Directly opposite on the other side of the river is an event venue where events such as fairs and concerts are held.  There is also the possibility to fill up with water, as well as to dispose of grey water and the toilet.

title: (2205) Rossio ao Sul do Tejo - 16 Rua do Carvalho

title_short: (2205) ParqueTejo - Turismo, Ciência e Lazer (Parque de Campismo e Caravanismo)
description: Nice camping park with a view over the  Tagus (Tejo) River and Abrantes town hill. Very nice  prices and facilities. All services are free (lot of combined electricity/fresh water plots). Restaurants and grocery stores within walking distance.

title: (2200) Abrantes - Parque de Abrantes
description: Picnic and bbq areas across the road in a lovely park.

title: (2200-491) Abrantes - R. de São Jerónimo
description: Parking lot on the edge of the city park São Lourenço in Abrantes, which offers children's playgrounds, barbecue and snack areas. A beautiful duck lake invites you to relax. Hiking trails and mountain bike trails in the immediate vicinity.

title: (2200-024) Alferrarede - 12 Rua Doutor David Serras Pereira
title_short: (2200-024) Alferrarede - 12 Rua Doutor David Serras Pereira

title: (2205) Tramagal - 62 N118

title: (2205) Tramagal -
description: Wonderful place to stay one night beside de river Tagus. very calm but a litle bit slopy. enough for 2 or 3 campers. we spent One night with the noise of the surrounding trees and the ducks at the river.

title: (2200) Abrantes - E806
description: Service station with picnic area, dump station and water. Cartridges or pipe systems,  not a drive on  dumping grate

title: (2200) Abrantes - Estrada do Gaio
description: Station service in abrantes, has free water, black water disposal and WC cleaning. Little supermarket inside and coffe shop. Outside has picnic tables.

title: (2230) Sardoal - N2
description: Quiet location by night, 300m away from EN2 road crossing and 150m from petrol station, with parking places not very flat to sleep. There are picnic tables, trash cans, water and a playground. About 500m away from lower area (several old fountains) of historic center of Sardoal village.

title: (2230) Sardoal -
description: Motorhome and full service area, on SARDOAL small town (even on iconic EN2 road), which historic center and shops are accessible by walking. The key must be picked at the fire department.

title: (2230) Sardoal - Travessa Do Freião
description: Place to park maximum 4 motorhomes. 400m till local products shop (“Cá da Terra”) and cultural center. 750m till historic center (buildings and streets from XVI century; pillory) and tourist office.

title: (2230) Sardoal - Unnamed Road
description: The name of the spot is LAPA Nice and quite place (except warm weekends). With barbecue and tables. To the village is 2km the only problem is that during the night it is dark and if you need help no one will help you. I don't recommend to sleep there. (2017) This year the fire devastated some of his beauty. In the winter is more beautiful that in the summer, but in the summer you can swim and refresh. Has been remodeled this summer (2017).

title: (2250) - Unnamed Road
description: Parking to visit downtown Viva Science Astronomie. For Myores and children. We spent one night without a problem. Only there was wind. Superb view.

title: () Praia do Ribatejo - N3

title: (2300) - Unnamed Road

title: (2140) Praia do Ribatejo - N118

title: (2230) Souto -
description: Schöner Platz am See mit Badezugang. 2 Marmor Picknicktische. Gerader Stellplatz. Sehr steile Zufahrt bergab, für mutige Fahrer. Nicht für Wohnmobile.  NICHT größer als VW Bus. Achtet auf das Wetter. Regen—> rutschig

name: Quinta das Lameiras
title: (2300) Quinta das Lameiras
description: Hello friends Our humble Biological Farm with an area of ​​3ha. We are 9km from the Templar city of Tomar, 4km from the river beach of Alverangel, 2.5km from the clean water river. Train station 3km away. We can be your Uber. We have a Hostel4campers with enough space for campers, caravans and some tents. Access to private bathroom; Common interior room (40m2 with sofas, swings and area for children to play; free kitchen with large table, free fridge, only washing machine and gas stove are paid ; There is also a outdoor leisure area with swings. Electricity 10amp; Disposal of dirty water and access to drinking water. Fresh homemade bread.. We can have a traditional Portuguese meal. We look forward to welcome you. Don't hesitate to visit our profile on Instagram (quinta_das_lameiras) or FB (Quinta das Lameiras - Sº Pedro de Tomar). We have a small grocery store where you can find products from our farm and other farmers. Depending on the season we have vegetables, fruit, eggs, cottage cheese, olive oil and duck meat, lamb, chicken and turkey, rice, tuna, vinegar, etc. Being happy is the most important thing! Our backyard is the world! Love of João, Sara and Children

title: (2140) - 1 Rua Conde de Murça

With larger campers you can stand on the plateaus. At 8.5 m it was easily accessible. Busy on weekends.

title: (2300) Tomar -
description: Beautiful little beach on Lake Carril, a stone's throw from Tomar! If you are looking for a place in nature for the night in order to visit Tomar the next day as I was, this is a great solution! Only downsides: the motorway which is really not far but little frequented at night, and the access which is a little steep on a dirt road should be avoided in rainy weather.

name: Quinta da Choupana
title: (2300-404) Quinta da Choupana
description:
Educational farm of 2.7 hectares, quiet and peaceful place. 4 km from the Templar city of Tomar, 30 km from the Sanctuary of Fátima, 1h30 from Lisbon and 2 hours from Porto. Near the dam of Castelo de Bode, Penedo Furado em Villa de Rei, dam of the Caril ...
Price for 2 adults and 2 children up to 13 years old. €5 extra per person.
Use of the swimming pool: €2/day/person.
THANKS

At the entrance to the village of Chouto Nationale 243, new motorhome area, gray and black water drainage, water tap, 12 electricity outlets (currently disabled).
200 meters from the center where there is pharmacy, restaurants, small supermarket.
Quiet, easy access to any size motorhome.
On-site garbage can is very small but just outside the gate is a bigger blue bin that is also a garbage can (see last photo).

description: Laundromat, right next door about 100m there is a continent good place to take advantage and go shopping

name: CAMPING ENVENDOS
title: (6120) CAMPING ENVENDOS
description: Location 10 x 10 m approx. Field surrounded and we live on the spot. Warning !! There is no electricity, sanitation or emptying. You can have the services electricity and emptying free to 5 km. located in a very quiet place. In the heart of the mountains, village within 500 m. Climbing, fishing, ideal hiking. Grocery, bar, tobacco, restaurant. Free swimming pool nearby at 100 m Baker passing on the ground If you like the peace it is by here!

title: (2350) - Estrada das Moreiras
description: Unpaved road in the eucalyptus and pine forest. Good for one night, fom campers only up to 6m.

title: (6100) trizio - Unnamed Road
description: This is a great place to stay to be off the grid. Super cheap to stay, but no WiFi. Conditions are not great but they will do

name: Miradouro de Fernandaires
title: (6100) Miradouro de Fernandaires
description: Spacious and quiet picnic area with an extended view point over Castelo do Bode dam arms. No amenities.

title: (6120) - Estradão Praia Fluvial (Ponte Asseiceira)
description: River Praia of Carvoeira. Nice river pools in a very beautiful natural environment. Parking on a slight slope. There is a bar, bathrooms and covered area with tables and grills with sink.

name: Parque de Campismo do Bostelim
title: (6110) Parque de Campismo do Bostelim
description: Rural campsite (Summer time) but external flat parking open all year round. Inside camping, electricity, hot water shower, wc, grills, lots of shadows, river beach. Access to electricity and water.

title: (6100) Palhais - Unnamed Road
description: Park near the road to Trizio beach. Nice view of the river. We spend the night here without any worries. For a maximum of one van

name: Praia fluvial de Fernandaire
title: () Praia fluvial de Fernandaire
description: Beautiful place near the beach. There is a bar near the beach. Open only in summer. Difficult access for wider motorhomes!

title: (2150-034) Azinhaga - 3 Rua da Misericórdia
description:
Parque da igreja matriz da Azinhaga.
Picnic area with grill, sink, water tap and electricity. Has picnic tables by a small river where you can see some birds. Very quiet.

title: (6100) Palhais -
description: Nice quiet place!

title: (2150-020) Azinhaga - 50 Rua Catarina Eufémia
description: Quiet parking lot on the outskirts of the village, next to a cemetery. The parking lot belongs to the adjacent residential building but is obviously not used much. The people here are very friendly and helpful. The night was very quiet, I felt safe.

title: () - CM1088
description: I

title: () - Rua Principal
description: Parking of the tourist site, small, cant provide hold, natural swimming pool very clean, restaurant, souvenirs, small beach at the end.

title: (2240) Vale Serrão - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place, better to reach with 4x4

title: (6100) Marmeleiro - Unnamed Road
description: Nice and quiet place! It's a fluvial beach unfinished! Can swim, have grills too, my dog likes it too!!

title: (6120) Corujeira - Estradão Praia Fluvial (Ponte da Ribeira Bostelim)
title_short: (6120) Corujeira - Estradão Praia Fluvial (Ponte da Ribeira Bostelim)
description: River Beach. Picnic area with tables, barbecue, water, light... The bar only opens in the summer season, the place is spectacular!

address.street: Estradão Praia Fluvial (Ponte da Ribeira Bostelim)

name: Barca da Amieira
title: (6050) Barca da Amieira
description: Just on left Tejo riverside at bottom of road to very small ferry. Currently, 2022-November, it is still under construction/improvement. 2 barbecue areas are built, the solar-powered small ferry too, 1 toilet house is set up for the hikers. Beginning of “Trilho da Barca da Amieira” wooden hiking, 3,6 km long.

title: (7480) Avis - Unnamed Road
description: Handy stopover on the main N2. It is just off the main road by the bridge over the rib. Isna down a steepish track. Nice spot by the water. There may be more places here but I didn’t have time to explore.

title: (2350) - 1 Rua dos Moinhos
description: Beautiful place in the middle of old mills with picnic tables enjoying a beautiful view from above over the valley, we spent one night there with our children without problem, no service.

title: (2435) Formigais - Rua Principal
description:
Parking area, newly planned and stepwise, graveled. 
with some trees and trash bins. 
very quite at night. around 900m to walk to the river bath with toilets, showers and restaurant.
the parking areas near the bath are very crowded in the season. 
(only 2G with NOS)

title: (6100) Sertã -
description: Beautiful spot with great views of both sunset and sunrise

title: (7425) Montargil - N2
description: Uncontrolled road water source

title: (6100) Palhais - 534
description: Real fresh spring water. Delicious.

title: (6120) Vale Grou -
description: Place pour dormir avec une vue incroyable, compliqué de monté en camping car.

title: (6120) - Unnamed Road
description: Wonderful place at a small waterfall. Access not easy! Rather 4x4! There is also a source of drinking water! Absolute peace! Google maps: Pego da Rainha

name: Ribeira da Venda
title: (6040) Ribeira da Venda
description: Nice place to spend day and overnight (no lightning) on both borders of very small river, 6 km away from N 118 road. Bar/restaurant owner told me the water was drinkable. There is a food button to get the water out. Children's playground and pools for them and adults; tables and grill with wooden and metal grid. Picturesque channel, with Roman bridge (now used as pedestrian). Bar closed off summertime, may be on Sundays rest of year;it’s Wi-Fi works. The toilets are not open but wooded. It's a real campsite, but without staff. Washbasin, tent area, playground. At the entrance there is a 3.5 t prohibition sign; as alternative and more flat, 100 m further turn to gravel way to the other riverside. Hiking PR 3. If you do not feel safe to overnight, drive to Comenda village where there is extended flat illuminated P at beginning of village (left side of road).

title: (2240) Dornes - EM521
description: Very quiet place to spend the night, overlooking Dornes, inside the locality it is very difficult to go since the streets are very narrow for larger camper vans.

title: (6040) Comenda (Castelo Cernado) - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of Ribeira da Venda beach. Very nice place to stay, has WC, shower for free, and place to washing your dishes. Also has an amazing surrounding.. Free pool for kids and a new one for adults. Stayed one nigth and had a very relaxing day. It also has a bar.

title: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Trilho da Barca da Amieira - E top
title_short: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Trilho da Barca da Amieira - E top
description:
Beautiful little free P in the hills just on left Tejo riverside, totally quiet. Spectacular view of the nearby dam and some fun hiking paths with art installations in nature. Very easy access on tarnac road. No services, no water. 
For vans up to 6m max (due to marks on floor of P), so not convenient for big motorhomes.

address.street: Trilho da Barca da Amieira - E top

title: (2240) Dornes - Unnamed Road
description:
Excellent view, quiet place.
Only for 4x4.

title: (2240-611) Dornes - Rua Rainha Santa Isabel
description: Beautiful place with amazing view over dornes town. Strong recommendation to walk fown on foot first as there is no turning around when cars are parked. its rather small and with a bit difficult access (narrow road). I wouldn't recommend it during summer months as its right next to the local lake beach and many cars park in this tight spot. would be ok overnight though. easy access to dornes town by bike 5min or by cannoe / sup 2min /walking 20min

title: (2240-624) Ferreira do Zêzere -
description: A widening in a path through the forest along the water. From the road it is a walking route, but easily accessible with a 4x4. Campers and vans will be more difficult as it is again a steep climb back to the road

title: (2240) Dornes - 10 Rua Nossa Senhora do Pranto
title_short: (2240) Dornes - 10 Rua Nossa Senhora do Pranto
description:
Uma vista lindíssima sobre o rio, vila de Dornes extremamente bonita e calma

A beautiful view over the river, village of Dornes extremely beautiful and calm. Town Wi-Fi. Small fountain close to the church or in the cemetery

title: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Access to Barca da Amieira Trail
title_short: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Access to Barca da Amieira Trail
description: Flat asphalt area (it was used for Fratel dam construction mobile residence) on isolation ambience at evening and night. Good place to overnight, very quiet and safe besides no lightning. Just a couple of trains during the night on opposite Tejo riverside. 5 min away from IP 2, near Fratel dam, so perfect if you are travelling. Very good to watch stars when no moonlight.

address.street: Access to Barca da Amieira Trail

title: (7400) Galveias - N244
description: Natural Spring to fill up jerrycans, tasty natural water

name: Barragem de Fratel - IP 2
title: (6030) Barragem de Fratel - IP 2
description: Free flat P on Northern top of Fratel dam, Tejo river, without shadows. Perfect for a lunch stop! Nice views, path for walk.

title: (2350) Pedrógão - 32 Rua Principal, R. do Arrife do Raro
title_short: (2350) Pedrógão - 32 Rua Principal, R. do Arrife do Raro
description: A few meters along the forest path there are several parking facilities. A little slope. Calm.

address.street: 32 Rua Principal, R. do Arrife do Raro

title: (2350) Pedrógão - R do Arrife do Raro
title_short: (2350) Pedrógão - R do Arrife do Raro
description: Place next to the picknick area, very nice and quiet. A lot of trees and you can do different hiking routes from here. Space for two campers next to the ‘road’.

title: (6150) Vale Água -
description: Nice and easy access tap next to the road. Good water pressure.

title: (6050) Amieira do Tejo -
description: Small quiet place to spend the night by the water under the eucaliptos

title: (7425) Montargil -
description: Very nice place in nature to rest, the national highway is not very far so there was a little noise from the cars

title: (2490) Ourém - 667 Rua Principal
description: Small village with possibility to park during the day or overnight close to the church. Worth to visit the Dinosaurs Park with feet printings of some of the biggest dinosaurs on earth (Sauropedes) and a small Jurassic Park. Possible to park at the Dinosaurs Park.

title: (2490) Ourém - Rua Principal
description: Nice quiet place in olive forest, no service available.

title: (6100) Palhais - N238
description: Natural water point and sitting area

title: (2350) Pedrógão - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area at an old quarry with a great view. Ascent from the nature camp only with off-road vehicle / 4x4! Motorhome drivers, please take a look, 30 minutes on foot. Large flat surface made of bare rock

title: (7425) Montargil - N2
description: Very nice quiet spot.Ideal for small vans.At the morning some local fishermans.Very nice place for Sunrise.

title: () Santarém - Unnamed Road
description: Here you can stand 4x4 in the riverbed, close to the water or up next to the path where it can be Dusty but if cars drive past. On the weekend possibly heavily visited by the locals. Our stay mid oct during the week was very pleasantly quiet.

title: (6150) São Pedro Esteval - N351
description: Local picnic area with trash bins, drinking water and a sheltered barbecue area

title: (6100) Cernache do Bonjardim - 24 Rua dos Peregrinos
title_short: (6100) Cernache do Bonjardim - 24 Rua dos Peregrinos
description: Waterpoint, high pressure! Taste: not so good, like most taps.

title: (6030) - Autoestrada da Beira Interior
description: Rest area is the main Highway (Motorway), A23, it has free water has air for check pressure in tires. Very clean bathroom, and good breakfast, with local products. Fill your tank of fuel and water (free and large flow). It has gas pump and bottles. Very good stop!

title: (7425) Montargil - N2
description: Near a large artificial lake, many spots to settle.  The least: many rubbish and toilet paper, testify a lot of squatte. More road next but not so much noise. Most: very charming setting, swimming and fishing possible, shade and many places to put the vehicle. Maybe a bit more difficult to access, in some places, for big motorhomes.

title: (7425) Montargil -
description: Beautiful place near the lake. Peaceful and calm

title: (7425) Montargil - N2
description: Easy access, great shades and awesome view. Perfect for small campervans. In front of the water.

title: (7425) Montargil - N2
description: Breathtaking, breathtaking, magnificent views over the lake. Complete silence with nature all around. Great place to watch the stars and sunrise, RVs are forbidden

title: (2000) - A1
description: Free park dedicated to Motorhomes or vancampers, low noise because of location far from A1.

title: (2490) Ourém - 7 Rua Doutor Francisco Sá Carneiro
title_short: (2490) Ourém - 7 Rua Doutor Francisco Sá Carneiro
description: 7 rua Doutor Francisco Sa, carneiro 2490 OUREM Very large car park, on sandy land behind large covered market. Parking without problem to spend the night as the day ...

title: () Sertã - Rua das Soagens
description: Parking right next to the police station and supermarket nearby.

name: Quinta Do Bella Vista
title: (6100-317) Quinta Do Bella Vista
description:
A beautiful quinta set in 2,5 ha grassland.
BBQ and pizza oven available.
10 min walk into small town where all services and amenities are available.
2 min walk into adjacent forest.
Delicious spring water available from the borehole on the land.
Make contact with owners before arrival.

name: Casa HNobre
title: (2000-736) Casa HNobre
description:
Private place to park a Van or Motorhome (<6m and 2m high) day 
or night. Water and electricity provided. 
Free WiFi. 
Swimming pool.
Wonderful sunset to enjoy and relax.

title: (2490-505) Ourém - 2 Rua Engenheiro Adelino Amaro da Costa
title_short: (2490-505) Ourém - 2 Rua Engenheiro Adelino Amaro da Costa
description:
Quiet place to reset from a trip.
Secure, near a police station. With a nice Parque to walk.

address.street: 2 Rua Engenheiro Adelino Amaro da Costa

title: (6100-730) Sertã - Alameda Carvalha
description:
Excellent parking and quiet at night. 
Near some restaurants and EN2.

title: (3260) - CM1146
description: Place with picnic tables just beside and with acess to a beautiful river beach. On summer and on weekends there’s locals visiting during weekdays it’s very calm and peaceful. It’s in the middle of the country and in the end of a mountain so will have a lot of curves on the road but nothing difficult.

title: (6100-730) Sertã - 4 Alameda Carvalha
description: Flat place and calm free park

title: (6150) - Unnamed Road
description: Top off the mountain, not easy access but very nice view.Ad a table and a tree.Very nice to see the Sunrise.

name: Parque Campismo Aldeia Ruiva
title: (6150) Parque Campismo Aldeia Ruiva
description:
"Parque Campismo Aldeia Ruiva"
Small camping with separate áreas for motorhomes, tents and bungalows, with dirty wathears under construction and near river beach.

title: (2490) Ourém - 1 Rua da Bela Vista
description: Simple parking provided for coach but without motorhome ban. Ideal for visiting a medieval castle and "city" inaccessible by camper (because streets limit the width to 2 m). Impossible to sleep there because very steep.

title: (2435) Rio de Couros - 117 Rua Principal
description: Picnic area with 3 + 6 tables with seats, some with shadows. Also grill space aside right side tables.

title: (2490) Ourém - Largo Santa Teresa de Ourém
title_short: (2490) Ourém - Largo Santa Teresa de Ourém
description: Car park easily accessible to 7 m motorhomes, space for half a turn and back by the same road.

title: (6100-735) Sertã - Nº 44 Avenida 25 de Abril
description: 5mts tall motorhome/truck wash,Also vacuum for Cars with Shade, laundry wash/dry clothes.

title: (6100) Sertã - 4 Urbanização Pinhal de Cima
description: Pleasant parking near the river. Swimming pool by the side. Max 3,5 t!

name: Bonjardim Boutique Hotel
title: (6100-459) Bonjardim Boutique Hotel
description:
Welcome to Bonjardim Boutique Hotel, Restaurant & Wines, an award-winning organic wine estate, slowfood restaurant and boutique hotel. The country manor dates back to 1756 and it is located in the tranquil green heart of Portugal. Wake up to vineyard views, indulge in wine tastings, explore our top-rated rooftop restaurant (rated 9+ / 10 on TheFork.com), or just take a relaxing walk in our private forest. Whether you’re a wine lover, digital nomad or foodie, we’ll make you forget the busy city life and help you explore the unspoiled center of Portugal.

Stay per night (includes water & electricity): €15 (if more than 2 persons, it is €3 per extra person)
Breakfast: €10 (reservation needed the day before)

Free amenities:
Indoor & Outdoor Swimming Pool
WiFi (password: bonjardim)
Parking for your motorbike
Top quality drinking water from our own well

Activities & services:
Wine cellar tour: €5 per person Wine tasting: €10 per person
Organic wine shop: You can buy Bonjardim natural wines in the restaurant. 
Wine course on request (min. 4 people): 1.5 hours (€25 per person). The themes are: Organic wine production; technical tasting; wine regions of Portugal; spirits. 
Restaurant with rooftop terrace: slowfood fusion menu with estate-grown and local produce. No reservations please, just walk in! For opening times, search “Bonjardim Sky Lounge Restaurant” or scan QR code:
Sauna: €7,50, Turkish bath: €7,50, Jacuzzi: €5
Massage: €40 / 0.5 hours , Yoga lessons: price on request
Picknick: €35, for 2 persons
Laundry: €5, pay at checkout.    Detergent is at the reception. Drying machine in winter is €2.50
Wastewater (black & grey): You can empty your wastewater at the dump station, located at the water tap at the Glamping’s solar panel. There are two covers where you can unload.
Waste: You can dispose of your waste in the bins in the small garage by the first gate (look for the tall palm trees).
Dog: €3 for the stay. Keep them leashed so our sheep don’t get chased. Pls remove any dog poop
Bathroom: find the outdoor bathroom down the stairs near the Glamping tents. The indoor shower and toilet are under the restaurant and 
Drinks: in the restaurant. Wines, beer, sodas, juice, sangria, cocktail, coffees, tea
Bread: You can get a bread bag if you want to order bread. On its label you write the number of bread buns you want (white or whole grain). Hang the bread bag in the evening, under the bell, at the main gate (tall palm trees). The baker comes at night; there’ll be bread in it tomorrow morning! (except Sundays). You can pay for it when you check out (€0.50/piece).
Checkout and payments are done at the restaurant reception, open from 10h00. If you want to check out earlier, please do the checkout on the evening before. 
Supermarket: Minimercado Salvador (1 km), supermarket Minipreço (2.5 km)

We hope you enjoy our little paradise we’ve been building since 1989.

title: (2140) Cantarinhas - Unnamed Road
description: I spent at ease with my 10T, 3 days in the pampas without seeing a cat;]

title: (6150) Proença-a-Nova -
description: Small parking lot, could spend the night there completely relaxed, including a 10m team. You can hardly hear the road above, the adjacent road is hardly used even in August.

title: (6100-211) Cernache do Bonjardim - 17 Rua José Joaquim Ribeiro dos Santos
title_short: (6100-211) Cernache do Bonjardim - 17 Rua José Joaquim Ribeiro dos Santos
description: Parking area set back from the road and from the town center and adjoining a green space ... calm, perfect end-of-day rest in a region where step solutions were lacking

address.street: 17 Rua José Joaquim Ribeiro dos Santos

title: (7425) Montargil - N2
description: Perfect place to spend an afternoon. We have been alone all day. It seems like a quiet place to spend the night. Narrow track access, better with a van.

title: (2435-116) Caxarias - 3 Avenida Nossa Senhora de Fátima
title_short: (2435-116) Caxarias - 3 Avenida Nossa Senhora de Fátima
description: Tap for full water. Provide the big end to connect.

title: (6100) Sertã -

title: (6150-519) Proença-a-Nova - 30 Largo da Devesa
description: Picnic tables in the middle of town, with shade and well-kept bathrooms.

title: (2000) Vale de Figueira - Unnamed Road
description: Shaded site at the end of a rural road with a source (uncontrolled) on the edge of a tributary of the Tagus

title: (2435) Freixianda - 48 EN356
description: Extended picnic and rest area, with about 12 tables+seats and without shadows and 10 grills, toilets including handicap, two lakes with dukes. Large playground. Possible to overnight
